page.title: 10FAMILY LIFE,WEST KILBRIDE(2)
page.content: Most children, on returning home from school will have{homework}exercises to complete. In Primary 7 this usually means about 30 minutes work per night. Afterwards, they might go out to play or watch T.V.{In the summer}they might go to the seaside and{in the winter they might sledge on the surrounding hilly slopes. Children who live in West Kilbride could never complain that there is "nothing to do." There are many{clubs {and societies}which are well attended and most families travel several miles to go swimming, ice_skating, etc. Children receive approximately Â£2 {pocket money}each week so they are able to afford to buy sweets, records, comics, etc. Many families also have "home entertainments" _ video recorders, stereo systems, home computers, etc.
